PCA9685 Class Reference

The PCA9685 class provides an interface for Arduino devices to access NXP's PCA9685 16-channel, 12-bit PWM Fm+ I2C-bus LED controller. More...

#include <PCA9685.h>

Detailed Description

The PCA9685 class provides an interface for Arduino devices to access NXP's PCA9685 16-channel, 12-bit PWM Fm+ I2C-bus LED controller.

Author:
GOM Copyright © 2014 GOM - X11 License

Definition at line 42 of file PCA9685.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum PCA9685::OutputChangeEvent

The OutputChangeEvent enum represents the different events on which the output will be changed.

Default: ChangeOnStop

Enumerator:
ChangeOnStop 

Outputs change on STOP command.

Allows synchronizing outputs of more than one PCA9685. Applicable to registers from 06h (LED0_ON_L) to 45h (LED15_OFF_H) only. One or more registers can be written, in any order, before STOP.

ChangeOnAcknowledge 

Update on ACK requires all 4 PWM channel registers to be loaded before outputs will change on the last ACK.

Definition at line 64 of file PCA9685.h.

enum PCA9685::OutputPolicyWhenDisabled

The OutputPolicyWhenDisabled enum represents the diffenrent ways to manage outputs behaviour when the /OE pin is set to logical 1 (output disabled).

Enumerator:
OutputFalse 

When /OE pin=1, outputs will be set to logical 0.

OutputTrue 

When /OE pin=1 (output drivers not enabled), outputs will be set to logical 1.

OutputHighImpedance 

When /OE pin=1 (output drivers not enabled), outputs will be set to high impedance.

Definition at line 81 of file PCA9685.h.

enum PCA9685::OutputStructure

The OutputStructure enum represents the different ways to manage output's internal ("electronic") structure.

Normal LEDs can be driven directly in either mode. Some newer LEDs include integrated Zener diodes to limit voltage transients, reduce EMI, protect the LEDs and these must be driven only in the open-drain mode to prevent overheating the IC.

Enumerator:
OutputStructureOpenDrain 

The 16 LEDn outputs are configured with an open-drain structure.

OutputStructureTotemPole 

The 16 LEDn outputs are configured with a totem pole structure.

Allows minimizing the amount of external components required to control the external driver (N-type or P-type device).

Definition at line 103 of file PCA9685.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

PCA9685::PCA9685 ( uint8_t  argAddress = DEFAULT_ADDRESS,
double  argClockFrequency = DEFAULT_CLOCKFREQUENCY_HZ 
)

Constructor; sets needed parameters.

Parameters:
argAddress The address of the PCA9685. Range: [0x40;0x7F].
argClockFrequency The clock frequency of the device counter.

argAddress is set to PCA9685::DEFAULT_ADDRESS by default, but it will depend on the hardware. See datasheet for details.

argClockFrequency is not absolutely needed to communicate with the device, it is used for some of this class' methods to perform operations such as calculation of the needed prescaler when setting output frequency with PCA9685::setOutputFrequency() or, the opposite way, to calculate the output's frequency from the read prescale value. If using the internal oscillator, frequency is 25MHz (set in PCA9685::DEFAULT_CLOCKFREQUENCY_HZ); otherwise it shall be set to the external clock frequency. See datasheet for applyable range.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

bool PCA9685::canRestart ( void   ) 

To know whether the device can be restored from a previous state, for example after the device has been put to sleep.

Returns:
true if the device can be "restarted".
false if no previous state can be restored.
Note:
Conditions that could make the device not to be restored: + Power cycle + I2C software reset command + If the MODE2 OCH bit is logic 0, write to any PWM register then issue an I2C-bus STOP. + If the MODE2 OCH bit is logic 1, write to all four PWM registers in any PWM channel.

Here is the call graph for this function:

bool PCA9685::setOutput ( uint8_t  argOutputNbr,
uint16_t  argOn,
uint16_t  argOff 
)

To set the cycle & phase of an output.

Parameters:
argOutputNbr The output to control. Range: [0;15]
argOn The value of the internal timer at which the output will be enabled. Range: [0;4095].
argOff The value of the internal timer at which the output will be disabled. Range: [0;4095].
Returns:
false if a parameter error has been detected
true otherwise.

Abstract from the datasheet:
The turn-on time of each LED driver output and the duty cycle of PWM can be controlled independently using the LEDn_ON and LEDn_OFF registers.
There will be two 12-bit registers per LED output. These registers will be programmed by the user. Both registers will hold a value from 0 to 4095. One 12-bit register will hold a value for the ON time and the other 12-bit register will hold the value for the OFF time. The ON and OFF times are compared with the value of a 12-bit counter that will be running continuously from 0000h to 0FFFh (0 to 4095 decimal).
The ON time, which is programmable, will be the time the LED output will be asserted and the OFF time, which is also programmable, will be the time when the LED output will be negated. In this way, the phase shift becomes completely programmable. The resolution for the phase shift is 1⁄4096 of the target frequency.

bool PCA9685::setOutputFrequency ( double  argFrequency_Hz  ) 

Calculates then sets internal counter's prescale value to let the output's frequency be as close as possible to argFrequency_Hz.

The outputs frequency depends on the internal counter's prescale value and its clock source's frequency.
This function calculates the reachable frequency range using PCA9685::clockFrequency(), checks if argFrequency_Hz is included in it, then calculates and sets the prescale value to be the closest to argFrequency_Hz.

Parameters:
argFrequency_Hz The target output frequency.
Returns:
**true** If argFrequency_Hz is in the reachable range;
**false** otherwise.
See also:
PCA9685::clockFrequency(), PCA9685::isUsingExternalClock(), PCA9685::outputPrescale()

Here is the call graph for this function:

void PCA9685::setSleeping ( bool  argIsSleeping  ) 

Sets the device's power mode.

When waking up the device (argIsSleeping==false) a delay of 500 microseconds is applied to avoid erroneous control registers readings.

Note:
It takes the oscillator up to 500µs to be up and running when waking up. Timings on LEDn outputs are not guaranteed if PWM control registers are accessed within the 500 μs window.
Note:
There is no start-up delay required when using the EXTCLK pin as the PWM clock.
Note:
No PWM control is possible when the oscillator is off. When the oscillator is off (Sleep mode) the LEDn outputs cannot be turned on, off or dimmed/blinked.
Parameters:
argIsSleeping + **true** Let the device go to sleep. + **false** Wake up the device.

void PCA9685::setUseExternalClock ( void   ) 

To use an external clock source instead of the internal one.

Warning:
the EXTCLK bit from MODE1 is a "sticky bit", it can ONLY be cleared by a power cycle or a software reset.
